title: Device schemas & wiring
lead: This page documents how to send IoT sensor readings to Flovers. You’ll find endpoint references, payload shape, and sample ESP32/ESP8266 Arduino code for common sensors. A wiring diagram placeholder is included and can be replaced with a Fritzing image later.

endpoints.title: API endpoints
endpoints.note: Endpoints shown here are examples. Replace with your production backend URL when wiring devices.

ingest.title: POST ingest documentation
ingest.desc: Send one reading sample as JSON. The backend validates device_key + secret and stores metrics under the device.

read.title: GET / read documentation
read.desc: Fetch readings for a device in a time range. If your backend supports POST-based queries, you can send a JSON body instead of query params.

arduino.title: Arduino (ESP32/ESP8266) sample code
arduino.desc: Reference implementation: connects to Wi-Fi, reads sensors, and POSTs JSON to the ingest endpoint on a fixed interval. Calibrate your soil sensor values for wet/dry to get meaningful %.
arduino.note: If you need accurate timestamps, add NTP time sync (configTime) and produce ISO-8601 UTC timestamps from the device clock.

sensors.moisture: Capacitive soil moisture sensor — analog read (calibrate wet/dry)
sensors.bme280: BME280 — temperature & humidity over I2C (pressure optional)
